skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: An Imperial pegasus is a noble, winged steed, intelligent and loyal.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Once trained to carry a man in battle, Imperial griffons are poised killers and incredibly dedicated to their riders.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.

skillTree.localised_description: The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: For Ostlanders gun ownership is more important than basic personal hygiene, they also love tinkering with their weapons and as such many of their weapons have double barrels.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Sure & True" for Handgunners, Outriders and War Wagon units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Handgunners, Outriders and War Wagon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Like his father before him, he has spent a lifetime fighting against Chaos warbands, raiding Norse, and marauding Orcs, not to mention the occasional forays of bandits from Kislev.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for Spearmen and Halberdiers
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Spearmen and Halberdiers
	(Lord's army)
Recruit rank: +3 for Spearmen and Halberdiers

skillTree.localised_description: "Those bull-headed Ostlanders really will eat anything..."
Ostland has tasted the lash of Chaos and their hatred of the evil ones knows no bounds.

At the head of his armies Valmir has fought against bandits, barbaric Orcs and Goblins, savage Beastmen, seaborne Norse raiding parties and marauding Chaos warbands. He is widely considered one of the most warlike leaders of The Empire.

effects.description:
Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

Experience gain for units: +100% when fighting against the Forces of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
This one won't move, won't roll over, won't give a solitary inch to anyone, ever, over anything.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.

As an elected governing official of the Empire, an Elector Count has the power and authority to raise troops from his home province. In times of need, or if a regiment is being raised by the right individual, the Count may grant his favor to a unit.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

factionEffects.localised_description: The Elector Counts of Ostland live on the northeastern border of the Empire beyond which lie the wild and dangerous Troll country and the Northern Wastes. It has always been a poor region where the constant threat of danger breeds a hardy race of people. The Elector Count of Ostland is Valmir von Raukov. Like his father before him, he has spent a lifetime fighting against Chaos warbands, raiding Norse, and marauding Orcs, not to mention the occasional forays of bandits from Kislev.

effects.description: Has access to unique building which grants access to Ogre Maneater units (requires the Ogre Kingdom DLC)

Armour: +20 for Spearmen and Halberdiers
	(all armies)

Attribute: Formation Attack for Spearmen and Halberdiers units
	(all armies)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit will try to stay in formation when in melee. Melee defence will be slightly increased.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Valmir von Raukov is a tough warlord whose constant vigil has protected the northern borders of the Empire for many years.

effects.description:
Attribute: Expert Charge Defence for Spearmen units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
